source: 211 North Dakota (veterans.nd.gov) and national veteran organizations database

resources.name: North Dakota Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.description: State agency assisting veterans in obtaining all federal and state benefits. Provides discharge documentation assistance, eligibility determination, transportation services, and veterans' preference in state employment.

resources.name: 2-1-1 North Dakota Information and Referral Service
resources.description: Free, confidential helpline connecting veterans to community resources including housing, employment, food, legal aid, mental health services, and benefits assistance. Live operators available.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line - National Support
resources.description: 24/7 confidential crisis support for veterans and their loved ones. Free support 365 days a year with real people qualified to support veterans. No VA enrollment required.

resources.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars - North Dakota Posts
resources.description: VFW membership organization providing VA claims assistance, financial grants, mental wellness support, student veteran support, and community programs. Accredited service officers provide free VA claims assistance.

resources.name: American Legion - North Dakota Department
resources.description: National veteran service organization offering member benefits, community support, youth programs, and connections to state and federal veteran benefits.

resources.name: VA Benefits Administration - Disability Compensation & Education
resources.address: Regional VA offices throughout North Dakota
resources.description: Federal VA office providing disability compensation, pension programs, GI Bill education and training, home loan assistance, vocational rehabilitation and employment services, and life insurance options.

resources.name: Volunteers of America - Veteran Services
resources.phone: Contact national office or local chapter
resources.description: National nonprofit providing behavioral and mental health services, affordable housing solutions, community outreach, and veteran services across 125 years of operation.

resources.name: Operation Homefront - Military and Veteran Family Support
resources.address: National organization based in Texas with nationwide reach
resources.description: National nonprofit providing critical financial assistance, housing programs, family events, and support for military and veteran families. Provides rent, utilities, food, and healthcare assistance.

resources.name: VetsinTech - Veteran Technology Education and Employment
resources.description: 501(c)(3) nonprofit connecting veterans and military spouses with technology education, employment placement, and entrepreneurship opportunities. Offers VIT Academy courses, mentorship, and local chapters.

resources.name: Homeless Shelter Directory - Veterans Housing Resources
resources.description: Directory maintaining 14,642 homeless shelters and social services across the United States, with 17,045 food pantries. Features veteran-focused shelters and housing programs.
